section.name: Welcome to the PinballX Setup Wizard
section.description: PinballX written by Tom Speirs.

setting.name: Notice
setting.description: This program should help make setting up PinballX easy. It will guide you through the important features of PinballX and allow you to customise the main functionality. You can run this program at any time and it will not interfere with your current settings. So you can come back at a later date, and don't have to configure everything now.

setting.name: WizardMode
setting.description: Please select your mode:

setting.name: PinballX Links
setting.description: Relevant Links

section.name: Custom Select
section.description: This section allows you to select the options you wish to configure.

section.name: Search Select
section.description: This section allows you to search the options you wish to configure.

section.name: General Settings
section.description: Here you can set various interface and general settings of PinballX.

setting.name: Desktop Mode
setting.description: Desktop mode sets up PinballX for non cabinet usage. When set the Desktop image and video folders will be used and PinballX will run Landscape.

setting.name: Enable Desktop Mode
setting.description: Enable Desktop Mode

setting.name: File Matching
setting.description: PinballX can perform additional file matching and searching for artwork, media and tables.

setting.name: Enable File Matching
setting.description: Perform additional searching for files.

setting.name: Wheel overlay images
setting.description: You can overlay wheel images with the system or company logo if you choose.

setting.name: Mode
setting.description: Choose whether to overlay images onto the wheel image.

setting.name: Systems list
setting.description: Enable a systems list in PinballX to list all systems.

setting.name: Enable
setting.description: Enable the systems list.

setting.name: Show on startup
setting.description: Always show the system list first at startup.

setting.name: Show additional detail
setting.description: When browsing tables additional information can be displayed including system, ratings, manufacturer logos and year.

setting.name: Enable
setting.description: Show the game name, manufacturer logo and year.

setting.name: Show System
setting.description: Show the system name or logo.

setting.name: Show Ratings
setting.description: Show game ratings when available.

setting.name: One click launch Table
setting.description: This setting allows you to immediately launch a table when selected and not show the menu list. Note: This disables access to the game information menu where you can access media and set game details.

setting.name: Enabled
setting.description: If enabled then immediately launch the table when chosen and not show the launch/info menu.

setting.name: Add missing tables
setting.description: Automatically add new and missing tables and enable them in the game manager.

setting.name: In Game Manager
setting.description: Automatically add new and missing tables and enable them in the game manager.

setting.name: In Front End
setting.description: Automatically add new and missing tables and enable them in PinballX.

setting.name: Enabled
setting.description: Enable the default search filters in PinballX, including popular decades and manufacturers. Disabling this feature allows more room on the menu for your custom databases but obviously disables functionality.

setting.name: Basic menu mode
setting.description: Enabling basic menu mode disables all filters and sub lists including favorites and just lists available media in the menu and the ability to launch the game.

setting.name: Enabled
setting.description: Enable basic menu mode.

setting.name: Table loading media mode
setting.description: This controls which media is used for loading images and videos when launching a table. PinballX can use the playfield image or you can use the loading image and video folders.

setting.name: Loading media
setting.description: Use table playfield images or loading folders.

setting.name: GIF background color
setting.description: When using loading folders and an animated GIF the background color to use.

section.name: Display Settings
section.description: Here you can set various display settings of PinballX.

setting.name: Use DirectB2S in Front End
setting.description: Actually use the Direct2BS file and display it on your Backglass monitor in PinballX. If a matching direct2bs file is found and the server is installed the file will be displayed.

setting.name: Auto Position DirectB2S
setting.description: Automatically position the Direct B2S window on your Backglass monitor when running Visual Pinball.

setting.name: Auto show DMD media
setting.description: Automatically show DMD image or video in a game if no DMD detected and game set to hide DMD.

setting.name: Auto position DMD
setting.description: Automatically position the PinMAME window on your DMD monitor when running Visual Pinball and automatically position the DMD window in PinballFX 2 and remove its borders.

setting.name: Hide PinMAME
setting.description: Automatically hide the PinMAME window when running Visual Pinball or using the setting below. This setting is for cabinets using real DMD displays and can automatically stop the PinMAME window displaying on the playfield.

setting.name: Use PinMAME in Front End
setting.description: Actually use the PinMAME ROM and display it on your DMD monitor or DMD unit when in PinballX.

setting.name: Window/Full Screen
setting.description: Run PinballX in windowed or full screen mode.

setting.name: Full Screen windowed
setting.description: When running full screen run in windowed non exclusive mode.

setting.name: Crop Wheel Images
setting.description: Automatically crop wheel images (remove transparent areas) and show them full size.

setting.name: Play Field Brightness
setting.description: Play Field Image and Video brightness.

setting.name: Enable game exit images
setting.description: Show exit images when returning to PinballX.

setting.name: Show exit image for
setting.description: Number of seconds to show the exit image for.

setting.name: Show date and time
setting.description: Show the current date and time in the top left of the primary display.

setting.name: Underlay image type
setting.description: Original scaled format or stretch underlay images to fill the screen.

setting.name: Wheel Text Color
setting.description: Color of Wheel Text.

setting.name: Wheel Text Outline Color
setting.description: Color of Wheel Text.

setting.name: Info Text Color
setting.description: Color of Info Text.

setting.name: Info Text Outline Color
setting.description: Color of Info Text.

setting.name: Filter Text Color
setting.description: Color of Filter/Title Text.

setting.name: Filter Text Outline Color
setting.description: Color of Filter/Title Text.

setting.name: Menu Color
setting.description: Color of selected menu items and information bar.

setting.name: Backglass
setting.description: You can specify the backglass positioning here.

setting.name: Real DMD
setting.description: Settings for real Pinball DMD displays

setting.name: Enable Color
setting.description: If you have a PinDMD3 or Pin2DMD connected you can enable RGB mode

setting.name: DMD Color
setting.description: If you have a PinDMD3 or Pin2DMD connected and decide not to use RGB color mode you can specift the mono color of the dmd display

setting.name: DMD
setting.description: You can specify the DMD positioning here.

setting.name: Topper
setting.description: You can specify the Topper positioning here.

setting.name: Apron
setting.description: You can specify the Apron positioning here.

section.name: Audio Settings
section.description: Here you can set various audio settings of PinballX.

setting.name: Stream Volume
setting.description: Ambiance and startup sound volume.

setting.name: Sample Volume
setting.description: Navigation and sound fx volume.

setting.name: Sound in Videos
setting.description: Play audio if in videos. Otherwise mute any sound in videos.

section.name: GameEx Online
section.description: GameEx Online allows you to access your game collection online and remotely control PinballX from any web enabled device. This feature also enables the PinballX download service and allows searching and downloading of media in the game list manager.

setting.name: Enabled
setting.description: Enable GameEx Online.

setting.name: Stream quality
setting.description: Set the quality for streaming audio and video. Higher settings use more bandwidth.

setting.name: Use Lite Media
setting.description: Search for Lite media online when using the Game Manager.

setting.name: Links
setting.description: Relevant Links

section.name: Startup Settings
section.description: Here you can set various startup settings of PinballX.

setting.name: Run PinballX when Windows starts
setting.description: This setting will automatically set PinballX to launch when Windows starts up.

setting.name: Start with Windows
setting.description: Set PinballX to launch when Windows starts.

setting.name: Run program on startup
setting.description: Launch a program on startup of PinballX

setting.name: Startup Program Enabled
setting.description: Launch Application At Startup

setting.name: Working Path
setting.description: The working path for the program to launch on startup.

setting.name: Executable
setting.description: The executable file to launch at startup

setting.name: Parameters
setting.description: The parameters.

setting.name: Wait For Exit
setting.description: Wait for execution of the application to complete before proceeding

setting.name: Hide Window
setting.description: Launch the application with a hidden window

section.name: Keyboard Input Settings
section.description: Here you can set various input settings of PinballX.

setting.name: Quit
setting.description: Quit Key

setting.name: Left
setting.description: Left Key

setting.name: Right
setting.description: Right Key

setting.name: Select/Start
setting.description: Select Key

setting.name: Rotate
setting.description: Rotate Key

setting.name: Page/Nudge Left
setting.description: PageLeft Key

setting.name: Page/Nudge Right
setting.description: PageRight Key

setting.name: Exit Emulator
setting.description: ExitEmulator Key

setting.name: Grab Screenshots
setting.description: Capture Screenshots Key

setting.name: Grab Videos
setting.description: Capture Videos Key

setting.name: Pause/In Game
setting.description: Pause Key

setting.name: Instructions
setting.description: Instructions Key

setting.name: Volume Down
setting.description: Volume Down Key

setting.name: Volume Up
setting.description: Volume Up Key

setting.name: Credit
setting.description: Visual Pinball credit key

setting.name: Plunger
setting.description: Visual Pinball plunger key

setting.name: Launch
setting.description: Launch Key. Bypasses info page

section.name: Joystick Input Settings
section.description: Here you can set various input settings of PinballX.

setting.name: Quit
setting.description: Quit Button

setting.name: Left
setting.description: Left Button

setting.name: Right
setting.description: Right Button

setting.name: Select/Start
setting.description: Select Button

setting.name: Rotate
setting.description: Rotate Button

setting.name: Page/Nudge Left
setting.description: PageLeft Button

setting.name: Page/Nudge Right
setting.description: PageRight Button

setting.name: Exit Emulator
setting.description: ExitEmulator Button

setting.name: Pause/In Game
setting.description: Pause Button

setting.name: Instructions
setting.description: Instructions Button

setting.name: Credit
setting.description: Visual Pinball credit key

setting.name: Plunger
setting.description: Visual Pinball plunger key

setting.name: Launch
setting.description: Launch button. Bypasses infor page

section.name: Text
section.description: Here you can set the various text settings of PinballX.

setting.name: Record Videos
setting.default: Capturing videos. Please wait. This will take several minutes.

section.name: Future Pinball
section.description: Here you can set the various Future Pinball settings of PinballX.

setting.name: Enabled
setting.description: Enable Future Pinball

setting.name: Working Path
setting.description: The working path of Future Pinball.

setting.name: Table Path
setting.description: The table path of Future Pinball.

setting.name: Executable
setting.description: The Future Pinball executable file. Usually 'Future Pinball.exe'

setting.name: Parameters
setting.description: The Future Pinball parameters. The following tags are supported and will be replaced with values - [TABLEPATH], [TABLEFILE], [TABLEFILEWOEXT], [MANUFACTURER], [YEAR], [SYSTEM], [RATING], [DESCRIPTION].

setting.name: FPRAM Path
setting.description: The Future Pinball FPRAM path. Required for high score support.

setting.name: Launch Before
setting.description: You can specify a program to launch before the system.

setting.name: Enable Launch Before
setting.description: Launch Application Before Emulator

setting.name: Launch Before Working Path
setting.description: The working path for the program to launch before.

setting.name: Launch Before Executable
setting.description: The executable file to launch before the emulator

setting.name: Launch Before Parameters
setting.description: The parameters. The following tags are supported and will be replaced with values - [TABLEPATH], [TABLEFILE], [TABLEFILEWOEXT], [MANUFACTURER], [YEAR], [SYSTEM], [RATING], [DESCRIPTION].

setting.name: Launch Before Wait For Exit
setting.description: Wait for execution of the application to complete before proceeding

setting.name: Launch Before Hide Window
setting.description: Launch the application with a hidden window

setting.name: Launch After
setting.description: You can specify a program to launch after the system.

setting.name: Enable Launch After
setting.description: Launch Application After Emulator

setting.name: Launch After Working Path
setting.description: The working path for the program to launch After.

setting.name: Launch After Executable
setting.description: The executable file to launch After the emulator

setting.name: Launch After Parameters
setting.description: The parameters. The following tags are supported and will be replaced with values - [TABLEPATH], [TABLEFILE], [TABLEFILEWOEXT], [MANUFACTURER], [YEAR], [SYSTEM], [RATING], [DESCRIPTION].

setting.name: Launch After Wait For Exit
setting.description: Wait for execution of the application to complete After proceeding

setting.name: Launch After Hide Window
setting.description: Launch the application with a hidden window

section.name: Visual Pinball
section.description: Here you can set the various Visual Pinball settings of PinballX.

setting.name: Enabled
setting.description: Enable Visual Pinball

setting.name: Working Path
setting.description: The working path of Visual Pinball.

setting.name: Table Path
setting.description: The table path of Visual Pinball.

setting.name: Executable
setting.description: The Visual Pinball executable file. Usually 'Future Pinball.exe'

setting.name: Parameters
setting.description: The Visual Pinball parameters. The following tags are supported and will be replaced with values - [TABLEPATH], [TABLEFILE], [TABLEFILEWOEXT], [MANUFACTURER], [YEAR], [SYSTEM], [RATING], [DESCRIPTION].

setting.name: Bypass Disclaimers
setting.description: Bypass ROM disclaimers by sending keys.

setting.name: Auto Configure
setting.description: Auto configure the resolution and controls in Visual Pinball based on PinballX settings.

setting.name: Full Screen Exclusive Hack
setting.description: Activate VP 10 window when it is running full screen exclusive.

setting.name: Extra wait for show desktop
setting.description: Additional wait before showing desktop. Needed for bug tables on some systems

setting.name: Launch Before
setting.description: You can specify a program to launch before the system.

setting.name: Enable Launch Before
setting.description: Launch Application Before Emulator

setting.name: Launch Before Working Path

setting.name: Launch Before Wait For Exit
setting.description: Wait for execution of the application to complete before proceeding

setting.description: Launch the application with a hidden window

setting.name: Launch After Working Path

setting.description: The executable file to launch After the emulator

setting.name: Launch After Parameters
setting.description: The parameters. The following tags are supported and will be replaced with values - [TABLEPATH], [TABLEFILE], [TABLEFILEWOEXT], [MANUFACTURER], [YEAR], [SYSTEM], [RATING], [DESCRIPTION].

section.name: Pinball FX2
section.description: Here you can set the various Pinball FX2 settings of PinballX.

setting.name: Enabled
setting.description: Enable Pinball FX2

setting.name: Working Path
setting.description: The working path of Steam or Pinball FX2.

setting.name: Executable
setting.description: The Steam or Pinball FX2 executable file. Usually 'Steam.exe'

setting.name: Parameters
setting.description: The Pinball FX2 or Steam parameters. Use default for Steam. The following tags are supported and will be replaced with values - [TABLEPATH], [TABLEFILE], [TABLEFILEWOEXT], [MANUFACTURER], [YEAR], [SYSTEM], [RATING], [DESCRIPTION].

setting.name: Process to monitor
setting.description: The Pinball FX2 executable process to monitor. Usually Pinball FX2.exe

setting.name: Wait For
setting.description: The time in seconds to wait before checking for the Pinball FX2 process and sending keys. On fast systems you may be able to reduce this value and on slower systems you might have to increase it. If using command line support with Pinball FX 2 set this to -1.

setting.name: Rotate Display
setting.description: The option to rotate the scren is not available in all versions of Pinball FX2. If you want PinballX to do it instead, selecte this option.

setting.name: Launch Before
setting.description: You can specify a program to launch before the system.

setting.name: Enable Launch Before
setting.description: Launch Application Before Emulator

setting.name: Launch Before Working Path
setting.description: The working path for the program to launch before.

setting.name: Launch Before Executable
setting.description: The executable file to launch before the emulator

setting.name: Launch Before Parameters
setting.description: The parameters. The following tags are supported and will be replaced with values - [TABLEPATH], [TABLEFILE], [TABLEFILEWOEXT], [MANUFACTURER], [YEAR], [SYSTEM], [RATING], [DESCRIPTION].

setting.name: Launch Before Wait For Exit
setting.description: Wait for execution of the application to complete before proceeding

setting.name: Launch Before Hide Window
setting.description: Launch the application with a hidden window

setting.name: Launch After
setting.description: You can specify a program to launch after the system.

setting.name: Enable Launch After
setting.description: Launch Application After Emulator

setting.name: Launch After Working Path
setting.description: The working path for the program to launch After.

setting.name: Launch After Executable
setting.description: The executable file to launch After the emulator

setting.name: Launch After Parameters
setting.description: The parameters. The following tags are supported and will be replaced with values - [TABLEPATH], [TABLEFILE], [TABLEFILEWOEXT], [MANUFACTURER], [YEAR], [SYSTEM], [RATING], [DESCRIPTION].

setting.name: Launch After Wait For Exit
setting.description: Wait for execution of the application to complete After proceeding

setting.name: Launch After Hide Window
setting.description: Launch the application with a hidden window

setting.name: Enabled

setting.name: Process to monitor
setting.description: The Pinball FX3 executable process to monitor. Usually Pinball FX3.exe

setting.name: Wait For
setting.description: The time in seconds to wait before checking for the Pinball FX3 process and sending keys. On fast systems you may be able to reduce this value and on slower systems you might have to increase it. If using command line support with Pinball FX 2 set this to -1.

setting.name: Rotate Display
setting.description: The option to rotate the scren is not available in all versions of Pinball FX3. If you want PinballX to do it instead, selecte this option.

setting.name: Launch Before Hide Window

setting.name: Launch After

setting.name: Launch After Parameters

section.name: Pinball Arcade
section.description: Here you can set the various Pinball Arcade settings of PinballX.

setting.name: Enabled
setting.description: Enable Pinball Arcade

setting.name: Interface Version
setting.description: The pinball arcade user interface. This may change from time to time and did so in June 2016. Unless for some reson you are using an old version of Pinball Arcade select the latest.

setting.name: Working Path
setting.description: The working path of Steam or Pinball Arcade.

setting.name: Executable
setting.description: The Steam or Pinball Arcade executable file. Usually 'Steam.exe'

setting.name: Parameters
setting.description: The Pinball Arcade or Steam parameters. Use default for Steam. The following tags are supported and will be replaced with values - [TABLEPATH], [TABLEFILE], [TABLEFILEWOEXT], [MANUFACTURER], [YEAR], [SYSTEM], [RATING], [DESCRIPTION].

setting.name: Process to monitor
setting.description: The Pinball Arcade executable process to monitor. Usually PinballArcade.exe

setting.name: Wait For
setting.description: The time in seconds to wait before checking for the Pinball Arcade process and sending keys. On fast systems you may be able to reduce this value and on slower systems you might have to increase it.

setting.name: Table Select Delay
setting.description: The delay to wait after sending the down key to select the table. For Free Cam Mod or DirectX 11 with big back buffer set to Long or Very Long.

setting.name: Launch Before
setting.description: You can specify a program to launch before the system.

setting.name: Enable Launch Before
setting.description: Launch Application Before Emulator

setting.name: Launch Before Working Path
setting.description: The working path for the program to launch before.

setting.name: Launch Before Executable
setting.description: The executable file to launch before the emulator

setting.name: Launch Before Parameters
setting.description: The parameters. The following tags are supported and will be replaced with values - [TABLEPATH], [TABLEFILE], [TABLEFILEWOEXT], [MANUFACTURER], [YEAR], [SYSTEM], [RATING], [DESCRIPTION].

setting.name: Launch Before Wait For Exit
setting.description: Wait for execution of the application to complete before proceeding

setting.name: Launch Before Hide Window
setting.description: Launch the application with a hidden window

setting.name: Launch After
setting.description: You can specify a program to launch after the system.

setting.name: Enable Launch After
setting.description: Launch Application After Emulator

setting.name: Launch After Working Path
setting.description: The working path for the program to launch After.

setting.name: Launch After Executable
setting.description: The executable file to launch After the emulator

setting.name: Launch After Parameters
setting.description: The parameters. The following tags are supported and will be replaced with values - [TABLEPATH], [TABLEFILE], [TABLEFILEWOEXT], [MANUFACTURER], [YEAR], [SYSTEM], [RATING], [DESCRIPTION].

setting.name: Launch After Wait For Exit
setting.description: Wait for execution of the application to complete After proceeding

setting.name: Launch After Hide Window
setting.description: Launch the application with a hidden window

section.name: Other Systems
section.description: Here you can set the other system settings of PinballX. Note that MAME compatible game lists can be created with GameEx and are available in the DATA\PinballX folder after updating the list.

setting.name: Select System
setting.description: Select the system.

setting.name: Name/Folder
setting.description: The name of the System and the Folder to use.

setting.name: Enabled
setting.description: Enable Other System

setting.name: System Type
setting.description: Specify a system type. If other than Custom, PinballX will treat it as the specified in built system and allow features such as high score support.

setting.name: Working Path
setting.description: The working path of Other System.

setting.name: Table Path
setting.description: The table path of Other System.

setting.name: Executable
setting.description: The Other System executable file. Usually 'Future Pinball.exe'

setting.name: Parameters
setting.description: The Other System parameters. The following tags are supported and will be replaced with values - [TABLEPATH], [TABLEFILE], [TABLEFILEWOEXT], [MANUFACTURER], [YEAR], [SYSTEM], [RATING], [DESCRIPTION].

setting.name: Process to monitor
setting.description: An optional additional executable to monitor for exit and to kill on exit.

setting.name: Launch Before
setting.description: You can specify a program to launch before the system.

setting.name: Enable Launch Before
setting.description: Launch Application Before System

setting.name: Launch Before Working Path
setting.description: The working path for the program to launch before.

setting.name: Launch Before Executable
setting.description: The executable file to launch before the emulator

setting.name: Launch Before Parameters
setting.description: The parameters. The following tags are supported and will be replaced with values - [TABLEPATH], [TABLEFILE], [TABLEFILEWOEXT], [MANUFACTURER], [YEAR], [SYSTEM], [RATING], [DESCRIPTION].

setting.name: Launch Before Wait For Exit
setting.description: Wait for execution of the application to complete before proceeding

setting.name: Launch Before Hide Window
setting.description: Launch the application with a hidden window

setting.name: Launch After
setting.description: You can specify a program to launch after the system.

setting.name: Enable Launch After
setting.description: Launch Application After System

setting.name: Launch After Working Path
setting.description: The working path for the program to launch After.

setting.name: Launch After Executable
setting.description: The executable file to launch After the system

setting.name: Launch After Parameters
setting.description: The parameters. The following tags are supported and will be replaced with values - [TABLEPATH], [TABLEFILE], [TABLEFILEWOEXT], [MANUFACTURER], [YEAR], [SYSTEM], [RATING], [DESCRIPTION].

setting.name: Launch After Wait For Exit
setting.description: Wait for execution of the application to complete After proceeding

setting.name: Launch After Hide Window
setting.description: Launch the application with a hidden window

setting.name: Links
setting.description: Relevant Links

section.name: Video Recording
section.description: Settings for video recording of games to automatically create your front end media. Configure the hot key under keyboard input. In order to work this feature requires that ffmpeg.exe be present in the PinballX application folder.

setting.name: Video Quality
setting.description: Video quality (CRF).

setting.name: Seconds to record
setting.description: Length in seconds of each recorded video

setting.name: Use H265
setting.description: Use HVEC h265 encoding instead of h264.

setting.name: Use GPU driver capture
setting.description: Use graphics card driver capture such as Geforce experience.

setting.name: Driver record start key
setting.description: If GPU driver capture enabled - dhe driver (such as gefore experience) hot key to start recording.

setting.name: Driver record stop key
setting.description: If GPU driver capture enabled - dhe driver (such as gefore experience) hot key to stop recording.

setting.name: Driver save path
setting.description: The path where the driver saves videos. This path will be scanned.

section.name: Attract Mode
section.description: Here you can set the various attract mode settings of PinballX.

setting.name: Mute Audio
setting.description: Mute audio when attract mode is running.

setting.name: Show high scores
setting.description: If available show high scores on the DMD.

section.name: Auto Exit
section.description: You can exit launched games automatically after a period of input inactivity. If enabled and no controls are pressed for the time specified the game will exit and return to the main interface.

section.name: Exit Screen
section.description: Here you can set the various Exit Screen settings of PinballX.

setting.name: Hold key to exit emulator
setting.description: Require exit emulator key to be held down for 6 seconds to exit game. A countdown timer will be shown on screen.

section.name: Exit Program
section.description: Here you can set a program to launch on Exit.

setting.name: Exit Program Enabled
setting.description: Launch Application At Exit

setting.name: Working Path
setting.description: The working path for the program to launch on Exit.

setting.name: Executable
setting.description: The executable file to launch at Exit

setting.name: Parameters
setting.description: The parameters.

setting.name: Wait For Exit
setting.description: Wait for execution of the application to complete before proceeding

setting.name: Hide Window
setting.description: Launch the application with a hidden window

section.name: Verify Setup
section.description: This part of setup allows you to verify your file paths are correct.

section.name: Finished Setup Wizard
section.description: That is all there is to it. Thank you for choosing PinballX!

setting.name: Donate
setting.description: To support continued development and availability of all the PinballX sites and future enhancements, you can make a most welcome donation by clicking below.

setting.name: PinballX Links
setting.description: Relevant Links
